column2: The power of the Chaos Gods waxes strong, none more so than Nurgle. His noxious blessings spills to his most putrid followers in a scene of pus dribbling boils and rife mutation. A most devout sect, the norscan Rotblood Tribe, emboldened and empowered amass to reek havoc on the world. They have made a pact with the skaven clan Fester and using their ungodly warpstone-powered portal are able to cross vast distances in an instant. This vile tide can be weakened, or sustained if you choose, depending on if Rotblood hold the following settlements.\\n\\n[[img:bullet_chs_corruption]][[/img]][[col:dark_g]] Altar of Spawns[[/col]]\\n[[img:bullet_chs_corruption]][[/img]][[col:dark_g]] Brass Keep[[/col]]\\n[[img:bullet_chs_corruption]][[/img]][[col:dark_g]] Xahutec[[/col]]\\n[[img:bullet_chs_corruption]][[/img]][[col:dark_g]] Serpent's Fang[[/col]]

Word from the Soutlands of rotting warriors reeking havoc in their wake, it is rumoured that the Cult of the Crimson Serpent at Serpent's fang have entered an unholy alliance with the Norscan Rotblood Tribe.
The Empire is in grave danger engulfed by the fanatic hordes of the Rotblood Tribe who spill forth from the portal at the Brass Keep.

Strange twisted creatures known as Chaos Dwarfs have appeared en masse from the east. It is their infernal intent to destroy all in their path until only they and the gods of Chaos rule the world. If the Dawi-Zharr are not driven back to the Dark Lands they will enslave all in their way sending them to the work the hellish forges of Zharrduk. They will eventually carve a new Empire of Ash leaving all but a place of smoky darkness.

Across the Worlds Edge Mountains hordes of warriors flood the slopes but these are no Kurgans. The norscan Rotblood tribe spill forth from the Skittergate to fufill their dreams of pestilence and destruction.

Legions of unnatural beings break through a once sealed portal, torn asunder at Xahutec the City of Echoes. The cursed ruins long home to evil ever since the Great Catastrophe now spawns the nightmares of mortals. The decaying throngs dread voices rise up in praise of the Rotfather, the arcane battle cries and unholy screams replacing the echoes of the city's fall a millennia ago.
The Rot spills into the waters off the Bleak Coast; the peoples of Naggarond, Ulthuan and the steaming jungles of Lustria pray the filth doesn't wash onto their shores.
Kislev must face the chaos they now all too well but their foe marches on their ill defended western borders. The rot emanating from the Brass Keep in the decaying Empire.
